_label: Pain's British Palladio: or, The Builder's General Assistant. demonstrating, in the most easy and practical method, all the Principal Rules of Architecture, from the Ground Plan to the Ornamental Finish. Illustrated with Several New and Useful Designs of Houses, with their Plans, Elevations, and Sections. Also, Clear and Ample Instructions, annexed to each subject, in Letter-Press; with a List of Prices for Materials, and Labour, and Labour only....The Whole correctly Engraved on Forty-two Folio Copper Plates, from the Original Designs of William and James Pain.
